definition[0]: to suggest that something is true, without saying this directly
example[0]: Cleo blushed. She had not meant to imply that he was lying.
definition[1]: if a fact, event etc implies something, it shows that it is likely to be true
example[2]: The high level of radiation in the rocks implies that they are volcanic in origin.
definition[2]: if one thing implies another, it proves that the second thing exists
example[3]: Democracy implies a respect for individual liberties.
example[4]: High profits do not necessarily imply efficiency.
